edge_1: Arielle Kebbel was cast to play the character of Gia Matteo, a beautiful architect hired by Christian to build his home in Fifty Shades Darker.
edge_2: Both sequels, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed, were adapted from the book sequels and produced by Michael De Luca Productions in 2016. They were shot back-to-back due to the continuity of the storyline.

edge_1: Arielle Kebbel was cast to play the character of Gia Matteo, a beautiful architect hired by Christian to build his home in Fifty Shades Darker.
edge_2: Both films, Fifty Shades Darker and Fifty Shades Freed, will be shot back-to-back with principal photography scheduled to commence in early 2016.
